title: Ticket #1819: SubmitInfo.pm needs some cmake love
description:
I went looking in the SubmitInfo.pm on the master branch and found things that
look like this:

my @minimal_build_configure_args =
    (
        '-DPROPER:BOOL=OFF'         => undef,
        '-DCLIPPED:BOOL=ON'         => undef,
        '-DWITH_BLAHP:BOOL=OFF'     => undef,
        '-DWITH_BOOST:BOOL=OFF'     => undef,
        '-DWITH_COREDUMPER:BOOL=OFF'    => undef,
        '-DWITH_CREAM:BOOL=OFF'     => undef,
        '-DWITH_CURL:BOOL=OFF'      => undef,
        '-DWITH_DRMAA:BOOL=OFF'     => undef,
        '-DWITH_EXPAT:BOOL=OFF'     => undef,
        '-DWITH_GCB:BOOL=OFF'       => undef,
        '-DWITH_GLOBUS:BOOL=OFF'    => undef,
        '-DWITH_GSOAP:BOOL=OFF'     => undef,
        '-DWITH_HADOOP:BOOL=OFF'    => undef,
        '-DWITH_KRB5:BOOL=OFF'      => undef,
        '-DWITH_LIBVIRT:BOOL=OFF'       => undef,
        '-DWITH_LIBXML2:BOOL=OFF'       => undef,
        '-DWITH_UNICOREGAHP:BOOL=OFF'   => undef,
        '-DWITH_VOMS:BOOL=OFF'      => undef,
    );

That's wrong since the arguments are key/value pairs but here the whole
thing being represented as only the key value. Instead it should be
(at the minimum) this:

my @minimal_build_configure_args =
    (
        '-DPROPER:BOOL'         => 'OFF',
        '-DCLIPPED:BOOL'         => 'ON',
        '-DWITH_BLAHP:BOOL'     => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_BOOST:BOOL'     => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_COREDUMPER:BOOL'    => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_CREAM:BOOL'     => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_CURL:BOOL'      => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_DRMAA:BOOL'     => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_EXPAT:BOOL'     => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_GCB:BOOL'       => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_GLOBUS:BOOL'    => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_GSOAP:BOOL'     => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_HADOOP:BOOL'    => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_KRB5:BOOL'      => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_LIBVIRT:BOOL'       => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_LIBXML2:BOOL'       => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_UNICOREGAHP:BOOL'   => 'OFF',
        '-DWITH_VOMS:BOOL'      => 'OFF',
    );

Then I noticed that Z added something like this (note the -G usage):

    'x86_64_winnt_5.1'  => {
        'build' => {
            'configure_args' => { '-G \"Visual Studio 9 2008\"' },
            'prereqs'   => undef,
            'xtests'    => undef,
        },

        'test' => {
            'configure_args' => { @default_test_configure_args },
            'prereqs'   => undef,
            'testclass' => [ @default_testclass ],
        },
    },

Which is wrong because it is an odd number of keys in the configure_args
hash table.

To make it a legal hash table definition, but following the wrong rendering
above, it would be:

            'configure_args' => { '-G \"Visual Studio 9 2008' => undef },

However, it really should be:

            'configure_args' => { '-G' => 'Visual Studio 9 2008' },

Then I noticed the larger problem that the SubmitInfo system was never
taught properly about how the cmake argument syntax differed from the
configure syntax.

For example, currently when '-DFOOBAR:BOOL' => 'OFF' is assembled, the =
sign is mandatorily enforced to form "-DFOOBAR:BOOL=OFF" and passed as a
command line argument. This is the same thing when the -G flag to cmake
is used. However, in that case the = sign is forbidden.

The method of option construction currently in SubmitInfo is a direct
result of how configure processes its arguments. In the configure flavor
of SubmitInfo, the difference between a key with an undef value and a
key with a defined value is whether or not a = gets used when the final
option to configure is generated. This is not true in the cmake system
for all arguments one can pass to cmake.

So, the right way to fix this is to construct two namespaces:

cmake_args => { '-G' => '\"Visual Studio 9 2008\"', etc, etc, etc },

cmake_cache_entries => { 'WITH_VOMS:BOOL' => 'OFF', etc, etc, etc },

where cmake_args are not assembled with an =, but cmake_cache_entries
are and the -D added when they are assembled.

I don't have time for this work at the moment, but this is what should
be done to bring the SubmitInfo system in sync with the cmake changes.

2010-Dec-21 14:12:50 by tstclair:
This seems like a good task for VDT as they will be maintaining this in the future.

_2011-Apr-13 by Scot Kronenfeld
I fixed this. Pete should review that the new format is correct. Note that I didn't implement it exactly how he wrote in the ticket. Per a discussion Pete and I had in my office a few weeks ago here's what I did. 

If the argument definition is
"-DFoo" => "Bar"
then you get the form
-DFoo='Bar'

If the argument definition is
"-DFoo Bar" => undef
then you get the form
-DFoo Bar

This allows the funky Windows style arguments to be expressed with minimal effort.

2011-Apr-13 16:19:24 by psilord:
Ok, I looked at the patch. The technical work is fine. I'm resolving the ticket.

However, it looks like a huge amount of additional whitespace changes also happened. Be careful to keep that stuff to a minimum or in a separate commit.
